results.title: Leslie Jordan, Comic Actor and Instagram Star, Dies at 67
results.abstract: Shows like “Will & Grace” made him a familiar face, then the pandemic brought new fame. He was killed in a car crash in Hollywood.

media.caption: Leslie Jordan, center, in a scene from the hit sitcom “Will & Grace.” He won an Emmy as the tart-tongued socialite Beverley Leslie.
media.copyright: Chris Haston/NBC Universal via Getty Images

results.byline: By Jenna Fisher, Remy Tumin, Johnny Diaz and Julie Bosman
results.title: Teen and Woman Killed in Shooting at St. Louis High School
results.abstract: The gunman, who was identified as a former student, also died after a shootout with the police at Central Visual and Performing Arts High School, the authorities said. At least seven other people were injured.

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.title: ‘We Heard It, We Saw It, Then We Opened Fire’
results.abstract: With an intense, hastily assembled effort, the Ukrainian military is pioneering successful techniques in the difficult art of anti-drone warfare.

media.caption: Police officers in Kyiv, Ukraine, trying to shoot down a drone during an attack on Oct. 17. The drone was believed to be an Iranian-made Shahed-136, purchased by Russia in August.

results.adx_keywords: Art;Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Museums;Global Warming;Monet, Claude;Museum Barberini;Last Generation;Potsdam (Germany)
results.title: Climate Activists Throw Mashed Potatoes on Monet Painting
results.abstract: The stunt in a German museum was the latest attack on widely admired art, carried out by protesters demanding action on climate change.

media.caption: After throwing mashed potatoes at a painting by Claude Monet, on exhibit in Potsdam, Germany, the climate protesters each glued a hand to the wall on Sunday.

results.byline: By Michael H. Keller and David D. Kirkpatrick
results.title: Their America Is Vanishing. Like Trump, They Insist They Were Cheated.
results.abstract: The white majority is fading, the economy is changing and there’s a pervasive sense of loss in districts where Republicans fought the outcome of the 2020 election.

media.caption: Downtown Richmond, Texas.

results.title: Alito Assured Ted Kennedy in 2005 of Respect for Roe v. Wade, Diary Says
results.abstract: In the senator’s recollection, the Supreme Court justice who wrote the opinion overturning the abortion ruling tried to show Mr. Kennedy that he was not a threat to Roe.

results.byline: By Sarah Mervosh and Ashley Wu
results.title: Math Scores Fell in Nearly Every State, and Reading Dipped on National Exam
results.abstract: The results, from what is known as the nation’s report card, offer the most definitive picture yet of the pandemic’s devastating impact on students.

media.caption: Not a single state was able to improve test scores for math.

results.title: ‘House of the Dragon’ Season 1 Finale Recap: A Queen Rises
results.abstract: A stirring, often moving season finale included many of the show’s signature elements as it set up the war to come.

media.caption: It’s not easy being queen. Emma D’Arcy in the season finale of “House of the Dragon.”

results.title: The One Where Matthew Perry Writes an Addiction Memoir
results.abstract: In “Friends, Lovers and the Big Terrible Thing,” the actor gets serious about sobriety, mortality, colostomy bags and pickleball.

media.caption: By the time he was 49, Matthew Perry writes in his new book, he had spent more than half of his life in treatment centers or sober living facilities.
media.copyright: Michelle Groskopf for The New York Times

results.byline: By Ben Sisario, Vanessa Friedman, Jessica Testa and Ellen Barry
results.title: Kanye West’s Offensive Behavior Makes Corporate Partners Squirm
results.abstract: The antisemitic outbursts and provocations by the artist now known as Ye have raised questions about how much offensive behavior companies are willing to tolerate from a proven moneymaker.

media.caption: Kanye West, now known as Ye, in New York last month. After several weeks of outbursts on social media and in interviews, several brands and designers have been distancing themselves from him.
media.copyright: Nina Westervelt for The New York Times

results.title: Four Takeaways From the DeSantis-Crist Debate in Florida’s Governor Race
results.abstract: Charlie Crist was eager to focus on abortion rights, while Gov. Ron DeSantis often turned his attention to President Biden.

results.title: Hasidic School to Pay $8 Million After Admitting to Widespread Fraud
results.abstract: The Central United Talmudical Academy, which operates the largest all-boys yeshiva in New York State, acknowledged illegally diverting money from federal food aid and other programs.

results.title: Prosecutors Pressure Trump Aides to Testify in Documents Case
results.abstract: The Justice Department’s effort to win the witnesses’ cooperation shows how the investigation stemming from the classified materials found at Mar-a-Lago is entering a new phase.

results.title: A ‘Tripledemic’? Flu and Other Infections Return as Covid Cases Rise
results.abstract: Flu cases are higher than usual for this time of year and are expected to soar in the coming weeks. A third virus, R.S.V., is straining pediatric hospitals in some states.

media.caption: A young girl receiving a Covid test at Esperanza Health Center in Chicago in September.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
